column4: i'm running lucid 10.04 and am trying to install a version of a package from natty using pinning. i get an error when i try to install the package. please see the paste of the apt sources, apt preferences, and the install error:
http://paste.ubuntu.com/647715/
make all the numbers different
the Pin-Priority settings?
twice 1000 is it good?
it seems that there's no package available for it in natty-security
if i comment out the natty-security entry then it works
but what if a natty security package is introduced in the future?
that's mine yesterday pinning prefs http://paste.ubuntu.com/647719/ but i can't make it usefull
aptitude search puppet
this works: http://paste.ubuntu.com/647723/
but i guess that works before there's no puppet package available in natty-security? what if an update is published there
no package?
it is in (debian) testing now, i think it must be in Natty
i'm saying i think it's in natty, but not in natty-security
so i have to comment out those lines (see pasebin) for natty-security, then it works when i try "apt-get install puppet"
so make 400 401 500 501 why not?
but this means that i'm ignoring any security updates for the package that might be published in the future?
oh yeah u have commented'em
it breaks if i uncomment it and set the priorities to 400, 401, 500, 501
hm why not to use something like hold in dpkg or aptitude ?
hardly say for me i never use it. it is in debian "apt-get -t stable install package" but for you ...
aptitude  forbid-version - this is what u need?
